decision_tree.node: Speech disturbance (including disorganized, impaired, or unusual speech)

children.condition: Due to the physiological effects of a substance (including medications)

yes.condition: Associated with a disturbance in attention and awareness characterized by a fluctuating course
yes.yes: SUBSTANCE INTOXICATION DELIRIUM; SUBSTANCE WITHDRAWAL DELIRIUM; MEDICATION-INDUCED DELIRIUM (3.16.1)

no.condition: Associated with evidence of decline in one or more of the following cognitive domains: complex attention, executive function, learning and memory, language, perceptual-motor, or social cognition
no.no: SUBSTANCE INTOXICATION; SUBSTANCE WITHDRAWAL; OTHER ADVERSE EFFECT OF MEDICATION

no.condition: Due to the physiological effects of a general medical condition

yes.condition: Associated with a disturbance in attention and awareness characterized by a fluctuating course
yes.yes: DELIRIUM DUE TO ANOTHER MEDICAL CONDITION (3.16.1)

no.condition: Associated with evidence of decline in one or more of the following cognitive domains: complex attention, executive function, learning memory, language, perceptual-motor, or social cognition
no.yes: MAJOR or MILD NEUROCOGNITIVE DISORDER DUE TO ANOTHER MEDICAL CONDITION (3.16.2)

no.condition: Rapid pressured speech with subjective sense of racing thoughts associated with euphoric, expansive, or irritable mood and increased energy
no.yes: MANIC EPISODE in BIPOLAR I DISORDER (3.3.1) or SCHIZOAFFECTIVE DISORDER (3.2.2)

no.condition: Slowed speech occurring in the context of an episode of depressed mood, diminished interest or pleasure, and other characteristic symptoms of depression
no.yes: MAJOR DEPRESSIVE EPISODE in MAJOR DEPRESSIVE DISORDER (3.4.1), BIPOLAR II (3.3.2) DISORDER, or SCHIZOAFFECTIVE DISORDER (3.2.2)
Catatonic symptom [see Catatonic Symptoms Tree (2.7) for differential diagnosis]

no.condition: Disorganized speech in association with delusions, hallucinations, grossly disorganized or catatonic behavior, or negative symptoms (e.g., diminished emotional expression or avolition)
Speech difficulties associated with problems in the acquisition and use of language due to deficits in comprehension and production
Difficulties with speech sound production that interferes with intelligibility
Disturbances in the normal fluency and time patterning of speech that are inappropriate for age and language skills
Deficit in social use of verbal and nonverbal communication

yes.condition: Accompanied by deficits in developing and understanding relationships, deficits in social-emotional reciprocity, and restricted, repetitive patterns of behavior, interests, or activities

no.condition: Clinically significant speech disturbance not covered above that represents a psychological or biological dysfunction in the individual
